properties.areaDesc: Eastern/Central El Paso County; Southern Tularosa Basin; Western El Paso County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 8:52PM MST until February 5 at 11:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, EL PASO AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Extended advisory to El Paso County due to precipitation band
changing to snow earlier than expected, which will increase snow
totals for El Paso, especially before midnight. Cold front moving
through the area with drop temperatures rapidly and change any
precipitation to snow overnight. Some moderate to heavy snow is
currently falling over the Sacramento Mountains and should
continue into Wednesday morning. The east slopes and central
portion of the mountains are expected to receive the heaviest
snowfall as low level east flow increases throughout tonight. Snow
accumulation is expected across El Paso and Hudspeth Counties and
the lowlands of Otero County. The snow should taper off and end
by around noon on Wednesday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. New snow accumulations of up to two
inches.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain changing over to snow tonight will
begin to accumulate as temperatures fall. Previously wet
roadways will freeze and create dangerous driving conditions.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest
Texas.

* TIMING...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce visibility
making for hazardous travel conditions. Road closures will be
possible, including Loop 375 Transmountain in El Paso.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY
